behaviors.behavior: Systematic planning and execution of fly fishing trips
behaviors.context: When anticipating a trip to Fly Fishing Montana
supporting_quotes: Uh, I start by tying a lot of flies when I'm anticipating. I usually go visit the rivers reports where I'm going to be fishing, and then I like to kind of see pictures of what other people are catching, and then look at forecast weather and when hatches will be happening when I'm there.

behaviors.behavior: Using Fly Fishing Montana platform consistently for seven years
supporting_quotes: I have been using Fly Fishing Montana for seven years, since the first day it launched.

goals.goal: Successful fly fishing experience in Montana
goals.motivation: Challenge of adapting to changing river conditions and finding where the fish are hiding
supporting_quotes: You gotta figure out where the fish went because they're not gonna be where you expected them to be. So when the river's up or the river's cloudy, you gotta go figure out where the fish are hiding.

goals.motivation: Relaxation and enjoyment in their free time, community interaction and exploration
supporting_quotes: Most of the time it's escapism because our hedonistic-

needs.need: A guide recommender tool for when preferred guide is unavailable
supporting_quotes: Well, configuring a trip, it's always nice to be able to see what, what boat is available. And also when a guide's not available that I like, maybe there's a way to have a guide recommender tool that shows me a guide that's similar, in the same area, but not th- the one that's a- available or...

pain_points.impact: Makes the fish move to unexpected locations, requiring the user to figure out where they have gone
supporting_quotes: You gotta figure out where the fish went because they're not gonna be where you expected them to be. So when the river's up or the river's cloudy, you gotta go figure out where the fish are hiding.

pain_points.impact: Diminishes the user's convenience and satisfaction with the platform
pain_points.pain_point: Frustration with booking guides when preferred guide is unavailable
supporting_quotes: Well, configuring a trip, it's always nice to be able to see what, what boat is available. And also when a guide's not available that I like, maybe there's a way to have a guide recommender tool that shows me a guide that's similar, in the same area, but not th- the one that's a- available or...

preferences.preference: Thorough trip planning by tying flies, studying river reports, observing other people’s catches, and checking the weather and hatch forecast
preferences.reason: Enjoys the process of preparing for their trip and the challenge of adapting to changing conditions
supporting_quotes: Uh, I start by tying a lot of flies when I'm anticipating. I usually go visit the rivers reports where I'm going to be fishing, and then I like to kind of see pictures of what other people are catching, and then look at forecast weather and when hatches will be happening when I'm there.

preferences.preference: Live tracking feature of the Fly Fishing Montana platform
preferences.reason: Allows them to see who's fishing where and to see their catches
supporting_quotes: But later, they added the feature where you could actually go see who's fishing where live and it allows me to keep track of the people that are on the river and see their exciting catches when they post pictures or even photographs of the hatch, and it really allows me a much more, uh, interactive-
